medical_history.chief_complaint: 36 hours of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began suddenly the morning prior to presentation, was localized and non-radiating. Associated symptoms included anorexia, nausea, and emesis. The patient denies fevers or chills. Similar pain occurred approximately one week prior but resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, reflux, asthma, pilonidal abscess, environmental allergies
